intro: Silene costata, commonly known as the fringed catchfly, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are often tinged with red or purple at the base. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as fields and dunes. Silene costata is an important species for pollinators and is considered a member of the Caryophyllaceae family.
